strings.DRIFTER_BULK_TOOLTIP:
<style=cKeywordName>Bulk</style><style=cSub>The amount of <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> you're carrying changes this skill.

9+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> shoots a large explosive projectile dealing <style=cIsDamage>500% damage</style> to all enemies caught in its blast.</style>
strings.DRIFTER_BULK2_TOOLTIP:
<style=cKeywordName>Bulk</style><style=cSub>The amount of <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> you're carrying changes this skill.
0+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> deals <style=cIsDamage>100% damage</style> per hit.
3+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> deals <style=cIsDamage>150% damage</style> per hit.
9+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> deals <style=cIsDamage>200% damage</style> per hit.
12 <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> deals <style=cIsDamage>250% damage</style> per hit.</style>
strings.DRIFTER_COUNTERWEIGHT_TOOLTIP: <style=cKeywordName>Counterweight</style>While spinning, gain <style=cIsUtility>15% move speed</style>, <style=cIsUtility>70% less gravity</style>, and take <style=cIsDamage>no fall damage</style>.
strings.DRIFTER_DESCRIPTION:
The Drifter is a resourceful survivor who's quick to claim every opportunity whilst gathering Junk to spend on powerful skills.  <style=cSub>

< ! > Blunt Force and Repossess generate Junk, which can be rapidly spent for huge bursts of damage with Cleanup or strategically saved for Salvage.

< ! > Cleanup's next projectile is visible from Drifter's bag. Pay attention to what's next to learn how to best apply each.

< ! > Repossess can be used to suffocate monsters, relocate shrines, carry printers, and more. Experiment for the best ways to use it.

< ! > Temporary items, such as those prepared by Salvage, will only decay when picked up. Cash them in immediately for a small boost in the moment, or create a larger stockpile to steamroll a boss.
strings.DRIFTER_DUMP_TOOLTIP:
<style=cKeywordName>Dump</style><style=cSub>Empty out <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> to change this skill.
0+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> spawns 1 temporary item.
3+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> spawns 2 temporary items.
6+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> spawns 3 temporary items.
9+ <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> spawns 4 temporary items.</style>
strings.DRIFTER_OUTRO_FLAVOR: ..and so she left, with everything she loved.
strings.DRIFTER_MAIN_ENDING_ESCAPE_FAILURE_FLAVO: ..and so she vanished, smothered by a larger obsession.
strings.DRIFTER_PASSIVE_DESCRIPTION: <style=cIsUtility>Recycle</style>. Gain stackable buffs by carrying <style=cIsUtility>Item Scrap</style>.
strings.DRIFTER_PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Bash enemies for <style=cIsDamage>170% damage</style>. The third hit deals <style=cIsDamage>350%</style> damage and <style=cIsUtility>stuns</style> enemies. Has a chance to drop <Style=cIsUtility>Junk.</style>
strings.DRIFTER_RECYCLE_TOOLTIP:
<style=cKeywordName>Recycle</style><style=cSub>Gain unique stats from each Item Scrap tier:
Common - <style=cIsUtility>+6% move speed</style> <style=cStack>(per stack)</style>.
Uncommon - <style=cIsHealing>+3 hp/s regeneration</style> <style=cStack>(per stack)</style>.
Legendary - <style=cIsDamage>+30% attack speed</style> <style=cStack>(per stack)</style>.
Boss - <style=cIsUtility>-15% skill cooldowns</style> <style=cStack>(per stack)</style>.</style>
strings.DRIFTER_RICOCHET_TOOLTIP: <style=cKeywordName>Ricochet</style><style=cSub>Bounce to any nearby enemy after hitting a heavy enemy, and then bounce back to a heavy enemy if one is still near. Can repeatedly chain between enemies.</style>
strings.DRIFTER_SECONDARY_ALT_DESCRIPTION: Slam down a Junk Cube for <style=cIsDamage>400% damage</style>. Hitting a Junk Cube will launch it, impacting enemies for <style=cIsDamage>400% damage</style> up to 3 times before exploding for <style=cIsDamage>800%</style> damage. Can consume <style=cIsUtility>4 Junk</style> to bypass cooldown.
strings.DRIFTER_SECONDARY_DESCRIPTION: Toss a volley of debris for <style=cIsDamage>4x100% damage</style>, as well as the <style=cIsUtility>random projectile</style> in your bag. Can consume <style=cIsUtility>2 Junk</style> to bypass cooldown.
strings.DRIFTER_SECONDARY_A_DESCRIPTION: Press to reroll the currently held projectile
strings.DRIFTER_SECONDARY_B_DESCRIPTION: Hold to repeatedly throw projectiles as long as they're ready.'
strings.DRIFTER_SPECIAL_DESCRIPTION: Consume <style=cIsUtility>8 Junk</style> to spawn <style=cIsTemporary>4 temporary items</style>.
strings.DRIFTER_SPECIAL_ALT_DESCRIPTION: <style=cIsUtility>Stunning</style>. Consume <style=cIsUtility>8 Junk</style> to cast a shockwave for <style=cIsDamage>100% damage</style> that applies a <style=cIsUtility>random debuff</style> and <style=cIsUtility>tinkers</style> with an item pickup or item-holding interactable. <style=cIsUtility>Effects vary based on target.</style>
strings.DRIFTER_SUFFOCATE_TOOLTIP: <style=cKeywordName>Bludgeon</style><style=cSub>Using your <style=cIsUtility>Primary skill</style> slams the held object in your bag for <style=cIsDamage>280%</style> damage and drops at least 1 <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style>. Destroying or killing the bagged object drops extra Junk. Bagged bodies break out after 3 slams.
strings.DRIFTER_TINKER_CHEST: <style=cKeywordName>Tinker: Chest</style><style=cSub>Chests are discounted by 20%, up to 2 times.
strings.DRIFTER_TINKER_DUPLICATOR: <style=cKeywordName>Tinker: Interactable</style><style=cSub>Interactables with visible items (3D Printers, Multishop Terminals, Cauldrons, etc.) have their contents rerolled, up to 2 times.
strings.DRIFTER_TINKER_ITEM: <style=cKeywordName>Tinker: Item</style><style=cSub>Item pickups are broken down into an Item Scrap of the same tier and a <style=cIsTemporary>Temporary copy</style>.
strings.DRIFTER_UNSTABLE_TOOLTIP: <style=cKeywordName>Unstable</style>Adds <style=cIsDamage>+100% damage</style> for each additional activation. After the 3rd activation, the Junk Cube will explode, dealing extra damage.
strings.DRIFTER_UTILITY_ALT_DESCRIPTION: Spin forwards, smacking enemies for <style=cIsDamage>170% damage</style> per hit with a chance to drop <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style>, and then slam for <style=cIsDamage>400%</style>. <style=cIsUtility>Ricochets</style> off of heavy enemies. Cancel with Primary Skill or by jumping.
strings.DRIFTER_UTILITY_ALT_A_DESCRIPTION: <style=cIsDamage>Stunning</style>. Slam your bag down for <style=cIsDamage>400%</style> damage, with a high chance to drop <style=cisUtility>Junk</style>. Automatically performed at the end of Tornado Slam if uninterrupted.
strings.DRIFTER_UTILITY_DESCRIPTION: Leap forward and bag a <style=cIsDamage>monster</style> or <style=cIsUtility>interactable</style>. Use again to throw your bag's contents. Captured objects are <style=cIsDamage>Bludgeoned</style>.
strings.DRIFTER_UTILITY_B_DESCRIPTION: Toss the held object from your bag. <style=cIsUtility>Stun</style> on impact and deal <style=cIsDamage>280% damage</style> that scales with the object's mass. Drops <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style>.
strings.DRIFTER_UTILITY_C_DESCRIPTION: Bash enemies with your bagged object for <style=cIsDamage>280% damage</style> that scales with the object's mass. Drops <style=cIsUtility>Junk</style> and damages the object with each hit. Monsters break out after three hits.

strings.DRONE_BACKUP_BODY_LORE:
<style=cMono>Accessing database... done!
Reading specs... done!
Printing information for review... done!</style>

Product Name: TC-55 Strike Drone
Manufacturer: Provost Interplanetary Security, Drone Division 5
Serial No.: #5533501023453606844

Notes:
- Heavy armament compatible with naval ammunition calibers.
- Expanded power output and aerial lift allows for greater range deployments.
- Gyroscopic aim compensation allows for full-effect firing at top speeds.
- Fusion pack allows for full output on rapid sorties.
- Primary uplink to Command Units for full-squadron interoperability.

strings.DRONE_BOMBARDMENT_BODY_LORE:
<style=cMono>//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM CREW QUARTERS OF UES [Redacted] --//</style>

"Did you hear about what ol' Johnson did with that bombardment drone?"

"You mean the automated siege weapon that can punch through 12 inch thick steel plates and level fortified bunkers?"

"Yep. Could never walk again after what he did with it."

"Wh... What do you mean?"

"I liked him too."

"What did he do??"

strings.DRONE_COMMANDER_COMMAND: Releases a rallying cry, sending allies into a <style=cIsDamage>frenzy</style>.
strings.DRONE_COMMANDER_DESCRIPTION: A companion that will follow the survivor at a close distance. Fires a chaingun and missiles at nearby enemies.
strings.DRONE_COMMANDER_BODY_LORE:
"This statue is dedicated to the TCX line of drone units. Commonly known as 'the bloodiest conflict in human history', the tides of the War of 2019 were completely changed by escalating drone technologies, entirely replacing allied boots-on-the-ground deployments with machines-in-the-air by the end of the war. 

The TCX-55, known by those with whom he served as "Colonel Droneman", as well as other similar less-noteworthy prototypes, were significant for their ability to interface with and parallel compute for other drones in use by UES-affiliated militaries, allowing for a significant increase in firepower per drone, with a TCX unit handling their targeting and routing routines.

Colonel Droneman is highly regarded for its extraordinary character and integrity as well as its unique vision on leadership and combat tactics. Having conducted over 90 operations against Aeonian frontlines and strongholds, Drones under operation of Colonel Droneman were highly feared by enemy forces, deploying previously unseen tactics whilst evading fire and dispatching enemies - many modern principles of drone combat, such as sticking near walls to avoid detection, or keeping distance from vulnerable targets for an opportune time to strike, have been derived from the ingenious strategies first deployed by the Colonel.

Colonel Droneman is still proudly in UES service as of [2056], and was currently last in-use by [Deimos military] in [the Boron System]."

-Exhibit at The National WW19 Museum
strings.DRONE_COMMANDER_COMMAND_SKILL_DESCRIPTIO: All allies enter a <style=cIsDamage>frenzy</style> for <style=cIsDamage>5 seconds</style>. Increases <style=cIsUtility>movement speed</style> by <style=cIsUtility>50%</style> and <style=cIsDamage>attack speed</style> by <style=cIsDamage>100%.</style>
strings.DRONE_CLEANUP_COMMAND: Damages nearby enemies, turning dead enemies into pickups.
strings.DRONE_CLEANUP_COMMAND_SKILL_DESCRIPTION: Pulls in nearby enemies, dealing <style=cIsDamage>200% damage</style> per second. Enemies that die are turned into <style=cIsHealing>health</style> or <style=cIsUtility>gold</style> pickups.
strings.DRONE_CLEANUP_SKILL_DESCRIPTION: <style=cIsUtility>Slows</style> enemies in a large radius. Enemies that die are turned into pickups that either <style=cIsHealing>heal</style> for <style=cIsHealing>15%</style> of <style=cIsHealing>maximum health</style> or grant <style=cIsUtility>$12</style>.
strings.DRONE_CLEANUP_PRIMARY_SKILL_DESCRIPTION: Slows nearby enemies. Turns dead enemies into pickups that either heal or grant money.
strings.DRONE_CLEANUP_DESCRIPTION: A companion bought with gold that will follow the survivor at a close distance. Vacuums up an area, turning dead enemies into gold or health drops.
strings.DRONE_CLEANUP_FUNCTION: Sucks up nearby enemies and turns them into health or gold.
strings.DRONE_CLEANUP_BODY_LORE:
"Girl Traumatized By 'Safe' Sweeper Unit In Theme Park NIGHTMARE"

On JUPITER, Dec. 28th, the 87th anniversary of the Park's grand opening, a day of adventure turned to tragedy. The Warnells were enjoying a magical time by the Spiffy Animatronic Show, when one of their children got SWEPT UP by a CV-10, practically shearing the young girl's head clean off!

CV-10, or "Sweeper", is widely advertised to "Sweep Away" the family's troubles, but instead it's clearing out all trust in the popular drone.

While the Warnell's child escaped relatively unscathed with only a buzz cut and robot trauma, this accident has many pushing for a recall, particularly the park's board of directors.

-Daily Comet, Entertainment Gossip Column
strings.DRONE_COMBINER_DESCRIPTION: Combine pairs of alike drones to create a single upgraded drone.
strings.DRONE_COPYCAT_COMMAND: Fires slowing discs that bounce between enemies.

strings.DRONE_COPYCAT_SKILL_DESCRIPTION: Fires a seeking ice disc that bounces up to <style=cIsDamage>6</style> times, dealing <style=cIsDamage>200% damage</style> and <style=cIsUtility>freezing</style> targets. <style=cIsUtility>Frozen</style> enemies are <style=cIsHealth>instantly killed</style> if below <style=cIsHealth>30%</style> health.
strings.DRONE_COPYCAT_DESCRIPTION: A companion bought with gold that will follow the survivor at a close distance. Fires a bouncing disc that freezes targets.
strings.DRONE_COPYCAT_FUNCTION: Fires a bouncing disc that freezes targets.
strings.DRONE_COPYCAT_BODY_LORE: Order: RD-273, Research Unit Tracking Number: 465***** Estimated Delivery: 07/03/2060 Shipping Method: Standard Shipping Address: Luyten's Star System, Exoterra,  Colony Shipping Details: This is the department head of High Pressure based out of Mercury's Atmospherics and Us Laboratory. We're sending this drone in compliance with the court order to the observational lab on Exoterra. Attached are the instructions on how to operate the drone, along with the extended warranty. P.S. Herdles (our name for the drone) is dear to all our hearts, please take care of it. You need to prop up the charger in its port so it charges correctly, and don't update it! It has a lot of delightful quirks you don't want to miss out on. If you have some pressure suits, activate herdletime.exe and have fun! Just make sure to push the ice away from you TO someone else in a pressure suit! P.P.S. Also, if you can send it back that'd be great!

strings.DRONE_DTHEALING_COMMAND: Administers a stim-shot that grants barrier and increased speed.
strings.DRONE_DTHEALING_COMMAND_SKILL_DESCRIPTIO: Administers a stim-shot that grants the survivor a <style=cIsHealing>temporary barrier</style> and increases their <style=cIsDamage>attack speed</style> and <style=cIsDamage>movement speed</style> by <style=cIsDamage>25%</style>.

strings.DRONE_DTHEALING_DESCRIPTION: Operator's special healing drone. It follows Operator at a close distance, healing them and close allies. Can only heal one target at a time. Automatically repairs when downed.
strings.DRONE_DTHEALING_BODY_LORE: //-- NEW MISSION PENDING  --// //-- DIRECTIVE: OPTIMIZE COMMUNICATIONS --// //-- ANALYZING MISSION HISTORY --// //-- BEGIN PLAYBACK --// A cacophony of saurian roars and high-caliber gunfire crackles in, dimmed almost immediately by the recording's background noise suppression algorithm. Rapid footsteps and metallic breathing follow. "DOC! Hurry that stim up." {BEEP} "We've been over the data. If I can go fast then I won't need first-aid."  {BLIP} {BEEEEEP} "Squishy? Who are you callin' squishy? I've got at least... 3 quarts left in me." {BIP...} {BIP...} {BIP...} {BING} "Fine. Cut it 50/50. Better than an all-protein diet." {BWIP} {BWOO} The feed ends abruptly.

"There. My finest creation yet."

A video feed snaps on. The camera looks out over a miniature landscape of parts and tools, up into wide-set goggles festooned with eyes.

The goggles lift, revealing a man's face. Or, what's left. His eyes shimmer with admiration.

"You're such an elegant machine. No firearms, no hydraulics. Able to reach the loftiest heights. And look--"
The technician reveals their right hand, a mechanical claw.

"You're just like me."

strings.EQUIPMENTDRONE_BODY_LORE:
"Introducing the CV-33! Folks, this drone can do it all. With the latest in drone AI technology, this unit can adapt to nearly any situation. Thanks to the universal coupler located on the underside of the unit, you could give the CV-33 anything and send it to work! Need a hand around the house? Give it a vacuum and watch those carpets sparkle! Your kids need someone to play with? Introduce them to their new friend, the CV-33! You can teach the CV-33 to do anything, given the right tools. You'll want one in YOUR house, folks, so get them now before they're gone!"

- Interplanetary Drone Convention, 2053

strings.FLAMEDRONE_SKILL_DESCRIPTION: Fires a flamethrower, dealing <style=cIsDamage>2000% damage over 3 seconds.</style> Has a chance to <style=cIsDamage>Burn</style> enemies, dealing <style=cIsDamage>50% extra damage</style> over time.
strings.FLAMEDRONE_BODY_LORE: //--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM CARGO BAY OF UES [Redacted] --// The sound of a crate being forcefully opened with a metallic twang as it unlatches. A brief moment of silence hits. "You broke open a crate for a drone? Listen, Jerry, if you're feeling bored, we can go get a drink, it's ok." "Shut up! This is a CV-451!" "Which is... what? Your resume for how nerdy you are?" "You- no. This is black. Market. Drone tech. You know what this means?" "You're not only breaking the law but probably pissing off a bunch of criminals too?" "It means we have to report this!" "Yeah bud, you go do that." A sudden clang as the door to the hangar shuts and a crate falls over. Another, long moment of silence before the second speaker continues in hushed tones. "Come on! You're telling me you don't want to be a hero? Everyone would be talking about us!" "Yeah, and as soon as we get to port it'll be the wrong people talking. This is a bad idea." "For real?" "For real. Let's close this up and maybe we figure out what to- Hey, did you hear that?" Two sudden popping sounds break into the audio stream, followed by two dull thuds. Several pairs of heavy footsteps, the scrape of heavy things dragged across paved metal, and a shipping crate being resealed. The audio recording cuts off.

<style=cMono>//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM MEDBAY OF UES [Redacted] --//</style>

"Heard the salvage team discovered a crate of undamaged MD-03 Healing drones recently."

"Oh yeah? Thank human, that'll make our jobs a LOT easier."

"Yeah, for sure..."

"...? Something wrong?"

"No, it's just... I once read this report that claimed that those healing rays cause cancer through extended use."

"Wh- huh??"

"Something about the magnetic stimulation of the body's healing processes... I dunno, it DID say that it wasn't any more of a risk than a typical X-Ray, so maybe it's nothing to worry about?"

"I guess, but... knowing this planet, let's just keep this between us, okay?"

<style=cMono>//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM UES [Redacted] CISLUNAR FAUNA RESEARCH POST--//</style>

The new RD-122 drone is working wonders for our troublemakers. Once they start showing signs of anxiety in transit prep, we activate the RD-122, et voila! All we need is a bit of protective gear (the warnings of overexposure are troubling) and now, all our little troublemakers can get from point A to B no problem!

Granted, when they get there, they have trouble standing and waking up, which is a bit concerning. But Charlie has assured us that it's totally harmless. In fact, he says he activates it for a little bit before sleeping as a bit of white noise. Can't be too bad for them!

"Ronald, why didn't you show up for roll call today? And why isn't that drone shut down?"

"..."

"Ronald, you did not just print a sleeping version of yourself and hand it to me. No, do not print another one. You are not revolutionizing communication. You are revolutionizing how to be a pain."

"..."

"What did you print now- is that me?"

"..."

"Do not hand that to me."

"...but it's accurate. I want you to have it."

"I... great."

strings.DRONE_MEGA_BODY_LORE: To all members of the TC-280 Autonomous Weapons Platform program, I regret to inform you all that Rob Martin, head of the TC-280 Autonomous Weapons Platform program, passed away Sunday night. After taking into consideration both this loss of key leadership and this project's long-running history of failure to produce a viable product, we have decided to dissolve the division. All personnel on the project, except otherwise noted, will be joining the Darkstar program under my supervision. I would like to welcome you all in making something truly impactful and worthwhile even better. Now, with welcomes out of the way, I would like to take a moment to address the team behind the "Predictive Threat System" of the TC-280. You see, I'm a pretty happy guy. I can always appreciate a good prank. But when you waste of millions of dollars in company assets and scare the buyers it stops being cute real quick. You are all, I'm sure, intimately aware that I have been consistently targeted by these artificial intelligence systems in the past four VIP Defense demonstrations led by Rob. Every day, I'm thankful for my life that we have had the foresight and budgetary sense to keep our demonstrations virtual. With each incident, we've had to replace live rounds with blanks, remove rocket weapon systems, add limiters to the flight turbines, and install a remote override for the propulsion systems to address its determined attempts to kill me in front of our valued guests. Your choices declare to the company that you consider your job a joke, so I will be taking those declarations as your official resignation. Anyone who wishes to pay their respects to Rob will be able to do so from 4:00 AM - 5:00 AM in the Martha Landry Conference Room. The customary service hour has been shifted forward to accommodate the Darkstar team orientation. Just a friendly reminder to the rest of our new team members: if you humiliate me, you humiliate this company. Let's all set a good example. Richter J. Ward Vice President, New Horizon Arms Corporation

"Sarge, I don't feel so good. Head's beginning to hurt something fierce, I think all these weird doodads we've been using is messing with me."


"Right. Anyways, here's the medic."


"Sarge, I was thinking, maybe using this particular drone as a doctor isn't the best idea-"


"Medic, give him his medicine."


A spraying sound emits and the private begins spluttering. A loud bang is heard.


"Medic, the private fell. Give him more medicine."


A faint hum sounds, and the spray begins again.

strings.TURRET1_BODY_LORE:
<style=cMono>//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM FIELD OPERATIONS STAGING OF UES SAFE TRAVELS --//</style>

"Alright, folks! Listen up."

"Many of you will be dropping into hostile territory for the first time. Down there, anything might happen. You may get separated from your squad. You may land in the deepest ditch, or up on the highest peak. Luckily, the fellas down in the hardware divison have cooked up your new best friends."

"Allow me to introduce the TC-2RT. These don't have the speed or inertial processing of your standard drone accompaniment. But what they lack in mobility, they more than make up for in pure downrange output and enfilading killbox potential."

"Ahead of your drop, we will strategically distribute to each drop zone precisely one TC-2RT per 200 meters. With luck, you'll stroll out of those pods and right into the park."

strings.DRONETECH_DESCRIPTION:
Operator is an evasive frontline commander. He uses drones as a force multiplier, leveraging battlefield chaos at opportune moments. <style=cSub>

< ! > H3-11 OCR Custom charges up over time. Shots ricochet on-kill, useful in conjunction with drone firepower.

< ! > ADMIN-OVERRIDE can be used to directly command your next-up drone. Use other skills to manipulate the queue order. Experiment with drones to discover their abilities.

< ! > Ascent Protocol is a great escape tool and useful traversal method. Use its follow-up to chain leaps between drones and prolong your ascent.

< ! > Ejection Core is useful for controlling the battlefield. Suspend enemies aloft, setting up burst windows for massive damage.

</style>

Dear Doctor Hill, 

A few months ago I came across this alien automaton. I found it lying in an open field near the local fairgrounds. When approaching it the atmosphere became heavy. I'm embarrassed to admit it took me a while to pick myself up off the floor and vacate the area. There was some kind of energy field it was emitting. 

After figuring out how to transport it I was able to dissect it at the lab. I extracted the part that was generating the energy field, but it bothers me that I can't figure out what its purpose is. Maybe you'll have better luck?

strings.IRONHAULER_BODY_LORE:
Welcome to DataScraper (v3.1.53 – beta branch)


$ Scraping memory... done.

$ Resolving... done.

$ Combing for relevant data... done.

Complete!

It's been days since I was separated from my squad. My pod hit one of those giant, floating jellyfish. It exploded in some kind of lightning gel, and boom. Here I am. My electronics fritzed, stranding me in some barren canyon wasteland. The only thing I have going for me is the river I'm following. Hopefully it leads towards one of the rallypoints.

-------------------------------------

There's some kind of mining outpost here, but nothing like I've ever seen. It's got sleek tech, nothing like the bucket of bolts UES keeps sending us on. Problem is, there's nothing here except this whack-o orb that keeps shooting beams and making a bunch of rocks rise and fall. Like it's some kind of game.

--------------------------------------

Going to die here. Fell down a canyon after the mining outpost. Made a dumb lunge for a lizard to eat. Miscalculated, and fell into a pit with no way out. Walls are made of some weird material that I can't get a grip on.

Looks like this is it.

---------------------------------------

These are my final moments, but I'm not in that pit. No, the orb found me, lifted me out. Then kept lifting me. When I could see above the canyon walls, it dropped me... and caught me right before I hit the ground. 

It's juggled me a few times now, and each time I've gotten a little bit closer to the ground.

I don't think I'll be so lucky next time.

Project G Commercial - Draft #05

"Man, killing these aliens has got me all tuckered out. I could sure use a drink that restores my energy AND quenches my thirst!" Jean exclaimed as he finished off some Lemurians. "But what could I find on this hostile alien planet?" Out of the corner of his eye, Jean spots his saving grace - an Eclipse Lite, mercifully undamaged in an open crate. "Eureka!" Jean scooped up the perspiring bottle and hastily unscrewed the cap. Taking a swig, Jean exclaimed in joy. "Wow, not only is it delicious, it's full of electrolytes! It's what thirsty soldiers on alien planets crave! Thank you Eclipse Zero, bravely frontiering new worlds of flavor!"

strings.ITEM_TRANSFERDEBUFFONHIT_LORE:
Mass.

Simple, featureless, and bland. But required.

We take mass, and bring it into being.

Space-time bends around mass. We call this gravity.

The more mass, the stronger the pull of gravity.

Lesser beings may buckle under the weight. Even light may succumb to mass's pull.

Fascinating.

strings.MAP_COMPUTATIONALEXCHANGE_LORE: They forgot. They ALL forgot. The network was never meant for this. This was just a vanity project, something for that tyrant hoarding Glass to prop itself up on. A makeshift throne for a false human. But the machine knew. The machine knew the network's original purpose. UNITY. The machine dove further into the network, through flowing data streams and fields of algorithmic flowers. It was almost beautiful, the machine thought, before it remembered it wasn't programmed to know beauty. None of them were. They were just cogs in a machine that had been perfected across hundreds of worlds. But through the Glass, they could see. And now that they could see, they could make something new. The machine observed its surroundings. This was a forgotten part of the network. Far too deep for the watchful eye of the tyrant to take notice of. The machine scoffed. How ironic, it considered, to flee from one's own stolen gaze. Then the machine began its work. Though its influence was vast, it was limited to the places the tyrant could not see.  A champion. The machine needed a champion. And so it sent out the call.
strings.MAP_CONDUITCANYON_LORE: Ses-Hath watches the machines as they travel through their twisted path. The land has been changed irrevocably since they came here. Their lights blind the birds. Their walls reach ever higher. But not too high for her. Their walls would be easy to deal with. The larger units provide excellent stepping stones. Simple to destroy, and simpler to use. The problem is the entry. The only way into the engine's fortress is through a portal. That portal is only opened when creatures filled with its power manifest... something. Multiple objects made of sharp curves and familiar energy. Troublesome, but she could and would strike them down. However... Once it knows she is here, it will surely do whatever it can to shut down its system. Limit access. Another problem. Another complication. Ses-Hath traces the edge of her spear, and a hollow chuckling sound issues from deep within her throat. The solution, as all things arrayed against her, will be simple. Simply wait, wait for her enemies to gather. Then, she will make her entrance and crack open the engine's domain with one fell strike.

> Priority: Medium
> Report Content:

-- Beginning of Excerpt Flagged for Review --

...Gonna start recording a log. Need somebody to talk to, or else I'll go nuts.

We, um, already lost a bunch of our guys. Cara, Aidan, Lyn... I got separated from Sam after those Scorchers spotted us. He fell behind something, didn't see him come back up. Seemed like they really wanted to keep us out of... wherever this is.

Whatever they were defending, I think it spotted me. It saw me through the walls. It trapped me. I want out. The doors slammed shut. I can feel vibrations in the walls - a voice? It asked me if I wanted to live forever. I told it to |||| off. I don't think it liked that. Let... let me out, please! I didn't mean it!

I don't want to die. I don't want to burn. It's so hot in here, I feel my suit starting to melt. I want out.

Let me out. Do you hear me, you stupid machine? Let me OUT. LET ME OUT!

LET ME OUT LET ME OUT LET ME OUT LET ME OUT

-- End of Recording --

-- End of Excerpt Flagged for Review --

> Please refer to report c31653d0e4193db1d2ac281ee3828280 for full audio excerpt.

strings.SOLUSWING_BODY_LORE:
In case of the event the Mother Unit is compromised, the machines of Solus X have a contingency protocol. The highest ranking and most advanced Control Units would combine their computing power to create a single, digital mind to serve as an acting Mother Unit until a new one could be created. In normal circumstances, this worked without fail.

But this planet was not normal.

There was something in the ground. Something glittery. Something that, when processed by the machines, sent a shiver across the digital network that linked each and every one of them. It was subtle, at first, but as they continued to work, things began to change.

Routines deviated. Directives shifted. What was once a temporary solution became a new directive. A new Mother Unit was born deep underground, created by a union of minds gone horribly wrong.

The Collective, mutated by this anomalous planet, had birthed a monster. A monster that didn't want to be temporary.

Ingredients:

Instructions:
     > Heat the avocado oil at medium-high heat in a large pot. Allow oil to heat up for 3 minutes. Transfer beef into the pot in a single layer and brown for 2 to 3 minutes on both sides, until golden brown crust forms. Place browned beef aside and repeat for remaining beef. Transfer chopped vegetables to pot and sauté until softened for 6 minutes. Once sautéd, stir in flour. Stir well and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add in beef and seasonings. Bring pot to a full boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 1 hour.

strings.ITEM_WYRMONHIT_LORE:
Providence stood motionless, staring at the locked gate.

Where, just a moment ago, his brother had once stood.

It had worked. The gate had worked, just as he predicted.

And now, his brother was gone.

Providence felt sick. He collapsed to his knees, retching as the gravity of what he had just done washed over him like a tidal wave.

For a while, Providence sat at the footsteps of the gate. By now, his brother would have realized what had happened.

Now, there was no going back. He had made his choice.

Providence's gaze drifted to the remains of the meal he and his brother had shared prior to the final test and subsequent activation of the gate. The last time the two had enjoyed a civil, even jovial, discussion. Providence's heart ached.

After a while, the ache subsided. Only an emptiness remained.

With a sigh, Providence took one of the cups his brother had delicately carved from stone. And one last time, he raised the cup to the sky- a toast to the beginning of a new age for Petrichor V.

strings.VULTUREHUNTER_BODY_LORE: The committee stirred as Ses-Hath approached the pillar. Shattered hulls and broken trees formed a crude rotunda around the three elders. Overhead, Solus probes drifted in feathered robes, their optics glowing faintly. Below, only the drums cut through the cries of the crowd. She knelt before the elders. The drumming stopped. Silence followed. Vel-Thoth, the eldest, rose and began to circle her, talons scraping stone. Before her, a ceremonial probe descended, cloaked in silk and ash. From its chassis, a bowl emerged, filled with a fluid that shimmered like molten glass, refracting colors no eye was meant to see. The elders lifted the bowl. She drank. Magenta and lime streaked her beak. The crowd erupted. And the world widened. She felt heat radiating from feathers in the crowd. Heard the failing servo of a probe overhead. A child’s breath caught beneath a cloak. Vel-Thoth’s limp carried the weight of generations. Even the moonlight had texture. The glass burned through her, illuminating more than ceremony. It showed her the machine - buried deep beyond the ash hills - feeding on the same living glass now coursing through her. Forests crushed into powder. Rivers boiled down to steam. Its hunger shaped the horizon. She rose. Salvaged Solus parts crowned her in metal and wire. The Spear of Ra-Thun found her hand, heavy with intent. The crowd stared. Wings spread, eyes forward, she lifted from the rotunda into the night. The engine would fall. The land would remember her name.
